meanings.definition: To bring to a successful conclusion or highest point.
meanings.sent1: After months of hard work, they were crowning their project with a big celebration.
meanings.sent2: The team was crowning their efforts with a well-deserved victory.
meanings.sent3: The cake was crowning the party, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The sun was crowning the horizon with a beautiful display of colors.
meanings.sent5: The final exam was crowning the semester, determining their success.

meanings.definition: The act of placing a crown on someone's head.
meanings.sent1: The queen's crowning ceremony was a grand event.
meanings.sent2: The crowning of the new king was met with cheers and applause.
meanings.sent3: The crowning moment of the play was when the prince received his crown.
meanings.sent4: The crowning of the prom queen was a highlight of the evening.
meanings.sent5: The crowning of the champion was a moment of pride for the entire team.

meanings.definition: The highest or most important part of something.
meanings.sent1: The crowning achievement of her career was winning the prestigious award.
meanings.sent2: The crowning jewel of the collection was a rare diamond necklace.
meanings.sent3: The crowning glory of the garden was a magnificent rose bush.
meanings.sent4: The crowning moment of the show was the surprise guest appearance.
meanings.sent5: The crowning touch to the outfit was a sparkling tiara.
